rdfs:comment.@value: Aptitude, capacity or power to act physically, socially, mentally, legally, or morally at a level suitable to the work context; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of ability types such as the O*NET cognitive, sensory, psychomotor and physical abilities; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Whether or not a requirement in a posting may be acquired post-hire.
Rating or score representing the difficulty of the particular entity to acquire.

skos:scopeNote.@value: The scale may be applied to any appropriate controlled vocabulary concept such as knowledge, skill, and ability as identified in the associated jdx:AnnotationDefinedTerm.

rdfs:comment.@value: Property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.
Physical address of the entity.
The relevant country of the resource. For example, USA.
The locality; e.g., Mountain View, London, Moscow.
The region; e.g., CA, TX.

skos:scopeNote.@value: The relevant state, province, territory or other subdivision of a nation.

rdfs:comment.@value: Resource referenced provides the means to make logical asserions about alternative conditions.
Description of an alternative credential fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.
Description of an alternative education or training fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.
Description of an alternative experience fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.
Entity providing qualifying notations including application of scales and other weights to concepts and competencies identified through a jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm.
Closing date for accepting applications.
Organization or person contact point for the posting.
Narrative instructions for applying for this position.
Physical location where job applications can be submitted.
Geographic location(s) in which employees may be located for remote (telecommuting) jobs.
Description of the area or domain to be assessed.
Resource describing an example assessment.
Type of method used to conduct an assessment; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of assessment method types such as the ceterms:AssessmentMethod vocabulary; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Motivator of performance including values, aspirations, and priorities necessary to successful performance of a task or job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of attitude types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Base salary of the job or of an employee in an employee role including minimum and maximum salary and unit value (e.g., hour, day, week, month, or year).
A code classifying the level of a candidate based on career experience; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of career level types (e.g., HR Open Standards CareerLevelCodeList.json); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Required country of the applicant's citizenship.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a country code list such as the Library of Congress' List of Countries (http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/countries.html).

rdfs:comment.@value: Observable and measurable knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes that contribute to enhanced employee performance of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. (HR)

skos:scopeNote.@value: This property has been defined as a super-property for a set of more refined subproperties including knowledge, skills, abilities, attitudes, tasks, and work activities that indicate qualification for the job; encode competencies using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Word or phrase used to refine and describe significant aspects of the entity.
A contact point for a person or organization.
Specification of the type of contact point.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of contact types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of credential such as badge, certification, bachelor degree; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of credential types (e.g., credential subclasses from CTDL); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Currency designation (e.g., USD).
Date on which the position was created.
Date on which the position was modified.
Date of posting by a channel.
Relationship between an organization and a department of that organization.
Identifies a resource from which properties of the resource being described were obtained in whole or in part.
A description of the item.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the jdx:formattedDescription property instead of the schema:description.

rdfs:comment.@value: Statement that denies aspects of a statement made or omitted by the employing entity in the position or posting.
Identifies a job board or media channel associated with a job posting.
Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.
Duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.
Word or phrase identifying the location of the person in terms of his or her progression through an education or training context; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of education levels such as ceterms:AudienceLevel or HR Open Standards IscedCodeList.json; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Email address of an organization or person.
Description of the employer, career opportunities and work environment.
Department, unit and/or facility where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.
Description of an equivalent credential for the position or occupation.
Description of equivalent education or training for the position or occupation.

skos:scopeNote.@value: An educational experience <u>without</u> award of a credential should be recorded with a range of jdx:QualifyingExperience. An educational experience <u>with</u> award of a credential should be recoded with a range of jdxCredential, not jdx:QualifyingExperience.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of equivalent experience for the position or occupation.

dct:description.@value: The estimated salary is usually computed by outside organizations and therefore the hiring organization is not bound to this estimated salary.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of the estimated salary for a job posting based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location.
Referenced artifact or performance confirming or supporting an assertion.
The type of referenced artifact, exam or performance confirming or supporting an assertion; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of evidence types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Category of experience needed for the position or Occupation; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience types including, but not limited to, "Education Experience", "Training Experience", "Work Experience" and it's subtypes "Apprenticeship" and "Traineeship"; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Fax number of an organization or person.
Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) identifying organizations, persons, states, government agencies, corporations, and companies.
HTML-tagged summary of the salient aspects of the job, including job responsibilities, qualifications, skills, working hours, education requirements, and experience requirements.

skos:scopeNote.@value: For language-tagged descriptions without embedded HTML markup, use the schema:description property.

rdfs:comment.@value: The geo coordinates of the place.

Referenced resource describes the major work tasks, knowledge, skills, and abilities requirements for carrying out those work tasks based on a job analysis that engages subject matter experts in defining and validating the importance, frequency, or other types of weightings of the enumerated competencies.
Entity referenced is a full description of a job defined and to be offered by the organization being described.

Description of a job position generally including the formal job title, duties, purpose, responsibilities, scope, reporting relationships and working conditions along with the knowledge, skills, abilities, education, qualifications, experience and other requirements for performing the job.

An online advertisement for filling one or more job position openings that contains information on the employer and the job position based on a job description as well as how and to apply for the job opening and how long the posting is valid for filling the job opening.
Resource providing instructions for posting a job position opening to a job board or media channel and for submission of applications.
Organization offering the job position.
Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.
A defined term set that contains this term.
The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc.

skos:scopeNote.@value: NOTE: Identifier in JDX has a constrained range of schema:PropertyValue. Best practice is to use schema:name property to textually identify the type of identifier, schema:value property to hold the textual value of the identifier, and the schema;properytID for a URI indicating the type of identifier.
NOTE: JDX defines subproperties called jdx:positionID and jdx:postingID to handle the employer's identifier for a particular position or posting.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of the most critical economic or work activities performed (e.g. software development, electronic manufacturing, motor vehicle production, or diagnostic and therapeutic services).

skos:scopeNote.@value: NOTE: The industry description expected here is a brief narrative of the most critical economic or work activities performed. To identify a formal industry code, such as NAICS in the U.S., use the industryCode property.

rdfs:comment.@value: Code from a controlled vocabulary of industry types identifying the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed.

skos:scopeNote.@value: NOTE: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

NOTE: In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels and locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations; the NAICS industry code here in JDX applies SOLELY to the location where the work of the job being described will be performed.

rdfs:comment.@value: The language of the content or performance or used in an action.
International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

Type of employment agreement (e.g. "employee", "contract-to-hire", "contract", "internship", "externship", "apprenticeship", "student", "volunteer", "under collective bargaining", "eligible for overtime"; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment contract agreements; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of benefits associated with the job (e.g., "employee discount", "health insurance", "401K plan"); select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of benefit types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

rdfs:comment.@value: Indicator as to whether a position is available for an immediate start.
Typically single geographic location where the work is performed.
A description of the job location (e.g., TELECOMMUTE for telecommute jobs).
Number of positions open at this location.
Schedule of the employment (e.g. "full-time", "part-time", "flex-time", "hourly", "shared-time"); select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment schedule types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

rdfs:comment.@value: Expected date when the employment begins.
Type of employment term (e.g. "regular", "temporary", "seasonal"); select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment term types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

dct:description.@value: Frequently treated as an aspect of the notion of "competency" along with "skills" and "abilities".

rdfs:comment.@value: Body of facts, principles, theories and practices that is related to a field of work or study; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of knowledge types such as the O*NET knowledge (https://www.onetonline.org/find/descriptor/browse/Knowledge/); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Latitude of a location. For example 37.42242.
The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.
An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.
Level of experience required; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience level types such as the HR Open CareerLevelCodeList.json; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: An associated logo.
Longitude of a location. For example -122.08585.
The upper value of some characteristic or property.
The median value.
Description of the minimum experience needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the minimum credential needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the minimum education needed for the position or occupation.
The lower value of some characteristic or property.
The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.
The name of the item.

skos:scopeNote.@value: NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

rdfs:comment.@value: Number of employees in the hiring organization.
Category of the relevant occupation of the job used in the country of employment; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of occupation categories such as the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: The larger organization that this organization is a subOrganization of, if any.

Pay cycle interval specifies how often the pay cycle occurs or, in other words, how often a person is paid, e.g., "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "yearly" etc.; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of pay cycles (e.g., the HR Open PayCycleIntervalCodeList); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: The 10th percentile value.
The 25th percentile value.
The 75th percentile value.
The 90th percentile value.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Resource identifying types of physical activity associated with a job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of physical activity types such as "bending", "standing", "sitting"; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of the physical requirements of the job including activities and their associated levels.

rdfs:comment.@value: Employer's identifier for a particular position.
Postal code; for example, 94043.
End date (time) for the posting.
Employer's identifier for a particular job posting.

skos:scopeNote.@value: For the identifier of the position for this posting, use jdx:positionID.

rdfs:comment.@value: Agent requesting the posting.
Start date (time) for the posting.
Whether or not the attribute being annotated has been given priority.
Resource referenced provides the means to make logical asserions about alternative conditions.
Description of the preferred credential needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the preferred education or training needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the preferred experience needed for the position or occupation.
Educational program of study.
Focused plan of study within a college or university degree such as a concentration in Aerospace Engineering within an Engineering degree.
URL indicating the type of the property and pointing to an external vocabulary.
Agent that provides, publishes, owns or otherwise has the authority to make the resource being described available.
Summary description of the ideal candidate's qualifications for a position.
Position(s) to which this position reports and over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.
Whether or not the attribute being annotated is required.
Resource referenced is an example of a direct, indirect, formative, and summative evaluation or estimation of the nature, ability, or quality of a person's performance or outcome of an action.
Whether or not a particular requirement is expected at the time of hiring or may be subsequently obtained.
Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.
Description of the required credential needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the required education or training needed for the position or occupation.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Specific credential requirements should use jdx:requiredCredential.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of the required experience needed for the position or occupation.
Key work tasks or activities over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of responsibilities; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of any exposure to risks associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens.

Types or categories of risk exposure associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of risk exposure types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

dct:description.@value: Where logically applicable, previously defined scales can be applied to a range of previously defined controlled concepts and competencies.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type or category of scale or weighting to be applied to a specific competency (knowledge, skill, ability), task, responsibility, interest etc.; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Description of any security clearance requirements.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Types of sensory functions required for sucessful job performance including hearing and vision; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of sensory functions; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of sensory requirements and levels necessary to function on the job including hearing and vision.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of the typical work shift of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of work shift types (e.g., HR Open Standards ShiftTypeCodeList.json); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

dct:description.@value: A skill is the ability to carry out a task with determined results often within a given amount of time, energy, or both. (Wikipedia)

rdfs:comment.@value: Ability to apply knowledge and use know-how to complete tasks and solve problems including types or categories of developed proficiency or dexterity in mental operations and physical processes required to fulfill a work role; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of skill types such as the O*NET skills; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Any special commitments associated with this job posting (e.g. low-income, native American, ex-offenders, military commit) along with any special exclusions (e.g. criminal records).
Street address; for example, "1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy".
A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary.
Piece or unit of work to be done or undertaken and accomplished within a defined period of time or by a deadline; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of task types such as O*NET tasks; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Tool, application or other form of technology that requires knowledge, skill and ability to use effectively in executing the tasks and responsibilities of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of technology types such as O*NET technology and tools; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: The telephone number of an organization or person.
A code that identifies this DefinedTerm within a DefinedTermSet.
The title of the job.
Total number of positions open at all locations.
Information about any required travel, systematic or occasional.
Unit of measurement on which values for schema:MonetaryAmount or schema:QuantitativeValue are based; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: On schema:MonetaryAmount, Google Jobs recommends using "HOUR", "DAY", "WEEK", "MONTH", "YEAR"; these values also appear in HR Open's PayCycleIntervalCodeList.json

rdfs:comment.@value: URL of the item.
The date from which the job posting is valid in ISO 8601 format; for example, "2017-02-24" or "2017-02-24T19:33:17+00:00".

dct:description:.@value: The date when the job posting will expire in ISO 8601 format. For example, "2017-02-24" or "2017-02-24T19:33:17+00:00" (Google) .

rdfs:comment.@value: The date after which the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
Value of the quantitative value or property value node.
Purposeful, systematic activity by one or more workers acting on a work objective to reach an intended outcome; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of activity types such as the O*NET work activities (https://www.onetonline.org/find/descriptor/browse/Work_Activities/); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Information on the work languages used for the job. (HR)
Typical working hours for this job; e.g. "1st shift", "night shift", "8am-5pm".
Word, name, acronym, phrase, defined in a controlled value space (e.g., taxonomy, glossary, dictionary, tag list, and other forms of enumeration).

skos:scopeNote.@value: Used in the context of JDX to assign terms from occupation, industry and instructional program classifications, skills and abilities, and abstract concepts to JDX entities. Through the class' relationship with the jdx:ScaledAnnotation class, terms can be conditioned through applications of scales for attributes such as importance and frequency.

rdfs:comment.@value: Entity that describes the key characteristics of an assessment administered to candidates for a job.
Entity providing the means to make logical asserions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.
Contact point—for example, for information about a job opening or interview.
Entity describing authoritative permission to hold a certain status or to do certain things, e.g. to practice some trade or profession.
A set of defined terms for example a set of categories or a classification scheme, a glossary, dictionary or enumeration.
Geographic coordinates of a place or event.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use to identify a place using geo coordinates; preferably includes a URI for the location as well as longitude and latitude from a service such as GeoNames (https://www.geonames.org/).

rdfs:comment.@value: Formally defined and titled role for performing a set of work tasks or activities.

skos:scopeNote.@value: The jdx:JobDescription, jdx:JobCompetencyProfile and jdx:JobPosting define windows into the content of the jdx:Job; do NOT use jdx:Job as an entity in any public facing resource. Entity used internally as "master" to which all properties used in JobDescription, JobPosting, and JobCompetencyProfile are applicable.

rdfs:comment.@value: Entity listing major work tasks, knowledge, skills, and abilities requirements for carrying out those work tasks based on a job analysis that engages subject matter experts in defining and validating the importance, frequency, or other types of weightings of the enumerated competencies.

Entity providing a statement of a job position generally including the formal job title, duties, purpose, responsibilities, scope, reporting relationships and working conditions along with the knowledge, skills, abilities, education, qualifications, experience and other requirements for performing the job.

dct:description.@value: Entity that contains information on the employer and the job position based on a job description as well as how to apply for the job opening and how long the posting is valid.

rdfs:comment.@value: Entity describing an on-line advertisement for filling one or more job openings.
A monetary value or range.

skos:scopeNote.@value: This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc.

rdfs:comment.@value: Statistical distribution of monetary amounts.
An organization such as a corporate body, employer, distribution channel provider.
Fixed physical location.
Mailing address of an entity.
Entity providing information about where and how a posting should be communicated.

skos:scopeNote.@value: A posting channel usually would be a job board or other advertising medium (HR).

dct:description.@value: Entity provides the means to define a needed property not otherwise defined in the JDX schema or profile.

rdfs:comment.@value: Property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of an entity.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Use PropertyValue sparingly! Always use a specific property from a known namespace when they serve your purpose. Using PropertyValue as a substitute for such properties will not trigger the same linked data function as the predicate of an RDF triple as will a more specific property.

rdfs:comment.@value: Entity describing verifiable work, education or training experience supporting a person's qualification to perform the tasks and responsibilities of a position.

skos:scopeNote.@value: A QualifyingExperience that results in the award of some form of credential should use the jdx:Credential class to describe that award.

rdfs:comment.@value: Point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.
Resource for identifying and applying a defined scale or rating to another resource.

skos:scopeNote.@value: Used, for example, when applying an importance scale to a competency identified in an instance of the AnnotatedDefinedTerm class.
